intro: Viguiera mima, commonly known as the Mexican ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky soils, thriving in full sun. Its showy purple to pink flowers bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Viguiera mima is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
